timeline.message:
Update Travis CI build configs

- Enable Java 16 (early access) builds now
  that we have Jacoco 0.8.6 with support for it
- Allow flaky Travis CI Mac build to fail
- Add Java 14 Linux build to replace Mac
- Only do full build matrix on pushes to master
  or release (e.g. v3.5) branches.
- Pull requests against master and pushes to
  feature branches only get a single Java 8 build

timeline.bodyText: We should probably stop using colors for allowlist/denylist.  Supposedly it's being looked at more and more by open source funders and makes them a bit uncomfortable when reviewing potential projects.  Probably best for us to start being better about this.
timeline.author: thadguidry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,9 +6,18 @@ jobs:
   include:
     - dist: trusty # Fastest build first
       jdk: oraclejdk8 # Trusty default
-    - jdk: openjdk11 # Bionic default
-    - jdk: openjdk13
-    - os: osx
+    # Whitelist release branches (e.g. v3.5)so they build on all platforms

replies.bodyText: Which colors and which allow/deny lists?
replies.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText:
The comment with Whitelist mentioned.
Btw, I've asked CS&S about general concerns on their Slack just so we have some guidance on this from them.  I'm not especially worried because I know human society is slowly changing and becoming "woke" or "aware" of bias in many things.  This is normal, societies improve over time and generally become more caring as they continue to learn from mistakes from the past.
Anyways, let's not get fully unfocused here.  It's just a comment for now, and let's wait to see what CS&S has to say because it will be helpful guidance for all.
replies.author: thadguidry

replies.bodyText: Oh right, okay. That's simple enough. @tfmorris could you change that comment to "Allow release branches (e.g. v3.5) to build on all platforms"?
replies.author: wetneb

replies.bodyText:
It's a USA thing.
@wetneb You have to scroll back up to see it, but the "Outdated" tag shows that this was already changed.
replies.author: tfmorris
